intro: Pachystela cinerea, commonly known as the grey pachystela, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems that are often covered in a whitish, powdery coating. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically yellow or greenish in color and appear in late spring or early summer. Pachystela cinerea is well adapted to arid environments and thrives in full sun with minimal water.
